benchmark_details.name: G2A-VReID (Ground-to-Aerial Video Re-Identification)
benchmark_details.overview: The G2A-VReID dataset consists of 185,907 images and 5,576 tracklets capturing 2,788 distinct identities for the task of cross-platform video-based person re-identification.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To construct a large-scale benchmark dataset for cross-platform video person ReID and propose methods for solving visual alignment problems.

data.source: Captured using UAVs and ground surveillance cameras at different heights and modes.
data.annotation: Annotated with boundary boxes and unique IDs for each person.

methods: Evaluated using Cumulative Matching Characteristic (CMC) and mean Average Precision (mAP)
methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on query and gallery video sequences.
methodology.interpretation: Higher mAP and Rank-1 values indicate better performance in video person re-identification.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted on existing video ReID datasets.

harm: Privacy risks due to the visibility of individuals in captured videos.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Facial information is masked with mosaic to protect privacy.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Licensed for non-profit academic research only.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Notification placed near data collection areas.
